alert.note: Alert for Harlan (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 28 at 8:37PM CDT until May 29 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 AM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Nebraska, including the following county, Harlan. * WHEN...Until 245 AM CDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 834 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen over the past few hours in parts of the area, and other parts of the area that have yet to see much rain could receive 1 to 3 inches over the next hour or two. An NWS observer in Orleans has measured 1.86 inches of rain since 5 PM CDT. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Methodist Creek, Cook Creek, Walnut Creek, Eureka Creek, Turkey Creek, Rope Creek, Sappa Creek, Milrose Creek, Prairie Dog Creek, Bone Creek, Dry Creek, Flag Creek, Crow Creek. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... Alma, Orleans, Republican City, Huntley and Harlan County Dam. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
